GER.NOTE: PG "alla-", PIE root "al-". Walde 90, Pokorny 25, Kluge "all", Watkins "al-5".

ENG.NOTE: OE "wīfman", from "wīf" `woman' + "man" `human'. Skeat. OED.

FRE.NOTE: Also used for `wife'. Lat. "fēmina" `female', from `nursing', "-meno-" participle of PIE root "dheH₁" `suck'. BW. Pokorny 652. EM "fecundus". Watkins "dhē(i)-".

GER.NOTE: OHG "frouwa" `lady', PG "frōwō-", PIE "prōwo-", root "per". Pokorny 810. Kluge "Frau". Watkins "per-1".

WORD.PHON: w a h i n e

STEM.PHON: w a h i n e

HAW.NOTE: Same word as `wife.' PCP "wafine", PPN "fafine", POc "(pa)pine", PCEMP "bai, (ba)b-in-ay", PMP "bahi, (ba)b-in-ahi". Commonly "-hine" in kinship terms, so the "wa-" is reduplicative. PE. Blust.

WORD.PHON: m u l i e r

STEM.PHON: m u l i e r

LAT.NOTE: Perhaps PIE "mel" `grind'. Pokorny 716. EM "mulier". Walde 285*.

WORD.PHON: ʔ a s dz áy n í

STEM.PHON: ʔ a s dz áy n í

NAV.NOTE: `(Young) woman', perhaps from "dzą́" `having a hole' (p. 166). YM 1992, p. 1015, 166.

TUR.NOTE: From `lady', from `wife of the khan', from Sgd. "xwātūn" `queen', from "xwātāw" `king'. Räsänen 157a.

ALB.NOTE: Loan from Pop. Lat. *"padūlem" `swamp', Class. "palūdem", nom. "palūs"; PIE "plHoud", from "pelH-eu". The root "pelH" may be the `fill' word or the `flow' word, and indeed the two roots may be the same. Mann 31. Huld 105. EM "palūs". Pokorny 799, 835.

ENG.NOTE: OE "wudu", from "widu", PG "widuz", PIE "widhus" `tree', perhaps from "weidh" `divide'. Skeat. OED. Pokorny 1177. Watkins "widhu-".

FRE.NOTE: Borrowed from Germanic, cf. Eng. "bush". For root, cf. "boisage". Dauzat. BW. Barnhart.

GER.NOTE: OHG "wald", PG "walþuz", PIE "welt" `wild', root perhaps "wel" `hair'. Pokorny 1139. Kluge "Wald". Watkins "welt-".

WORD.PHON: u l u l aː ʔ a u

STEM.PHON: u l u l aː ʔ a u

LAT.NOTE: Walde 507*.

WORD.PHON: ts i n t a h

STEM.PHON: ts i n t a h

NAV.NOTE: "Tsin" `tree' + "tah" `among'.

ALB.NOTE: PIE "kʷr̥mi-" `worm'. The initial consonant does not match with the Germanic and Lat. forms, but the parallel is so close there must be some kind of (analogical?) connection. Huld 82. Mann 36. Pokorny 649. EM "uermis". Walde 523. Not in Janson.

ENG.NOTE: OE "wyrm", PG "wurmiz", PIE "wr̥mis", root "wer" `turn'. Skeat. OED. Pokorny 1152. Watkins "wer-3".

FRE.NOTE: LAT "vermis". BW.

GER.NOTE: OHG "wurm", PG "wurmiz", PIE "wr̥mis", root "wer" `turn'. Kluge "Wurm". Pokorny 1152.

WORD.PHON: w e r m i s

LAT.NOTE: PIE "wr̥mis", root "wer" `turn'. Pokorny 1152. EM "uermis". Walde 270. Watkins "wer-3".

NAV.NOTE: `Worm, bug'. PA "tsh'ɨsh", PPA "tsh'ɨsh". YM 1992, p. 115 "CH'OSH".

WORD.PHON: s o l u dʒ a n

STEM.PHON: s o l u dʒ a n

TUR.NOTE: Probably a native word, but influenced by Arm. /soƚun/ `creeping thing'. Räsänen 425b. Dankoff, p. 168.

ALB.NOTE: PIE "wetes", root "wet" `year'. Huld 129. Pokorny 1175. Mann 96.

ENG.NOTE: Angl. OE "gēr", PG "jǣram", PIE "yērom", base "yēr", possibly root "ei" `go'. Skeat. OED. Pokorny 297. Watkins "yēr-".

FRE.NOTE: Extension (perhaps already Pop. Lat. "annata") on LAT "annus". PIE root "at". BW.

GER.NOTE: OHG "jār", PG "jǣram", see ENG. Kluge "Jahr". Pokorny 297.

WORD.PHON: m a k a h i k i

STEM.PHON: m a k a h i k i

HAW.NOTE: PEP "matafiti" or "matasiti". Could this be a compound of "maka" `eye, beginning' + "hiki" `celestial direction'? PE.

LAT.NOTE: PIE "atnos", root "at" `go, year'. Pokorny 69. EM "annus". Walde 41. Watkins "at-".

NAV.NOTE: `Winter, year'. PA "x̣a̶y". YM 1992, p. 237.

TUR.NOTE: Loan from Arabic. Stachowski, v. 3, p. 70. Wehr 505a.

ALB.NOTE: Loan from Lat. "viridis", q.v. under `green'. PIE root possibly "weis". Mann 110. Huld 84.

ENG.NOTE: OE "geolo", PG "gelwaz", PIE "g̑helwo-", root "g̑hel". Skeat. OED. Pokorny 429. Watkins "ghel-2".

FRE.NOTE: Lat. "galbinus" `pale green', from "galbus". That itself appears late, may be from PIE "g̑hel-". Pokorny 429. EM "galbus". Huld 84. Dauzat.

GER.NOTE: OHG "gelo", PG "gelwaz", PIE "g̑helwo", root "g̑hel". Pokorny 429.

WORD.PHON: m e l e m e l e

STEM.PHON: m e l e m e l e

WORD.PHON: f l aː w o s

LAT.NOTE: PIE "bhlēwos" `blue, yellow', ext. of "bhel" `shining'. Or possibly connected with "flos" `flower'. Pokorny 160. EM "flauus". Walde 212*. Watkins "bhel-1".

NAV.NOTE: `It is yellow', neuter. PA "tsu̶gḥ", PPA "tsu̶x̣". YM 1992, p. 613 "TSOII" `yellow, tan'. Pinnow 37.

ALB.NOTE: PIE "wes", same root as LAT, but not as ENG. Mann 36. Huld 78. Walde 209. Pokorny 514.

ENG.NOTE: Same as `thou'. OE "ēow" (obl.), PG "iuwiz", PIE oblique "yu". Skeat. OED. Pokorny 514. Watkins "yu-1".

FRE.NOTE: LAT "vos", unstressed, see LAT. BW.

GER.NOTE: OHG "ir", PWG "jiz", PIE oblique "yu", but with the vowel crossed with that of "wir" `we'. Kluge "ihr". Pokorny 514.

HAW.NOTE: "-kou" is plural suffix. Probably connected to singular "`oe". PE.

LAT.NOTE: PIE "wō̆s", root "we". Pokorny 514. EM "uos". Walde 209. Watkins "wō̆s".

NAV.NOTE: Emphatic independent, subjective case. YM 1992, p. 930.
